org.tinfour.gis.utils

Class VertexWithClassification

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tinfour.common.Vertex
      • org.tinfour.gis.utils.VertexWithClassification
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISamplePoint

    public class VertexWithClassification
extends Vertex
    A representation of a vertex with a lidar classification value (see LAS Specification 1.4, American Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing (ASPRS)).

    • Constructor Detail

      • VertexWithClassification

        public VertexWithClassification(double x,
                                double y,
                                double z,
                                int index,
                                int classification)
        Constructs a vertex with the lidar classification value extracted from the source file. The ASPRS spec allows for classification codes from 0 to 255. It formally defines values 0 to 18 (with up to 63 reserved for future use) and leaves the rest as user definable. Here are the main ones:
        1. Created, never classified
        2. Unclassified
        3. Ground
        4. Low vegetation
        5. Medium vegetation
        6. High vegetation
        7. Building
        8. Low point (noise)
        9. Reserved
        10. Water
        Parameters:
        x - the X horizontal coordinate for the lidar sample point
        y - the Y horizontal coordinate for the lidar sample point
        z - the vertical coordinate for the lidar sample point
        index - the record number for the lidar sample point
        classification - the classification value assigned to the lidar sample point.

    • Method Detail

      • getClassification

        public int getClassification()
        Gets the classification code indicating the kind of feature from which the sample was captured.
        Returns:
        an integer value in the range zero to 255, usually in the range 0 to 9.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Vertex
